column4: anyone know how to instal the latest version of firefox, have it autoupdate, keep my bookmarks and not have to worry too much about plugins that are already installed by synaptic?
if you add the firefox ppa you can install 3.7 but its very flakey
do I have to uninstall my current version of firefox?
in jaunty its a seperate app. in karmic its a true upgrade
you can keep both side by side
that is actually awesome..  but do they share the same bookmarks ?
also I have extension I used extensively...
when you run te new version its compatibilty will be checked
nice! So I simply do sudo apt-get install firefox-3.5
thanks for that. So if I add new packages, it will update whatever DB it's using (sort of like what is done with "locate"?
you mean I have to  do "sudo apt-file update" if I add a new repo ?
no problem.. very useful, I remember it was built-in on mandriva
modify /etc/apt/sources.list and comment out the lines for the repos you don't want, use a # character at the start of the line
